title: Gretel Killeen fuels reports that she's returning to host Big Brother 2020
text:
Gretel Killeen has fuelled speculation that she's set to return as the host of Big Brother for the show's upcoming 2020 reboot.

During an appearance on Weekend Sunrise on Saturday, the 56-year-old refused to deny reports that she's 'had discussions' to host the revival.

'As if I’m going to tell you that!' she laughed when questioned by host Basil Zempilas.

'I think that is a groundbreaking show': During an appearance on Weekend Sunrise, Gretel Killeen refused to deny reports that she's 'had discussions' to host the Big Brother reboot

When asked if she'd 'like' to host the reboot, Gretel continued to deflect and made a joke about her dating life.

After being pressed further, the media personality said: 'I think that is a groundbreaking show.

'I think the way we did it previously was so exciting because you not only never knew what was going to happen but you never knew what I was going to say.'

'I think the way we did it previously was so exciting because you not only never knew what was going to happen but you never knew what I was going to say,' the 56-year-old said of her time hosting Big Brother

She continued refusing to give a direct answer until the segment finally came to an end.

On Friday, former Big Brother winner Reggie Bird warned producers that the upcoming revival of the show will only be successful if Gretel returns as host.

She told News.com.au: 'You've got to have Gretel. She is the mother of Big Brother.'

Legend: Gretel hosted Big Brother for seven seasons before being replaced by Kyle Sandilands and Jackie 'O' Henderson in 2008

She added: 'If you're going to bring it back you should have Gretel as host and Mike Goldman back doing the voice-overs as well.'

Gretel, 56, hosted Big Brother for seven seasons before being replaced by Kyle Sandilands and Jackie 'O' Henderson in 2008.

It was confirmed earlier this week that Big Brother Australia will be returning for a new season in 2020.

'You've got to have Gretel!' Former Big Brother winner Reggie Bird warned producers that the upcoming revival of the show will only be successful if Gretel returns as host

According to TV Blackbox, it will air on Channel Seven, with the networking planning to finance the show using the budget originally allocated for the now-cancelled Sunday Night.

Endemol Shine has opened applications for Big Brother 2020 and potential housemates can apply online.

Big Brother famously launched the careers of Chrissie Swan (season three), Ryan 'Fitzy' Fitzgerald (season four) and Blair McDonough (season one).
description: Gretel Killeen has fuelled speculation that she's set to return as the host of Big Brother for the show's upcoming 2020 reboot.
